Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the east commons

This is the eastern side of Docktown's common area. The cobbled ground, stone walls, and bench have all been replaced or repaired where needed and shine with that 'new stone' gleam. Panels, doors, frames and other previously damaged woodwork, have been replaced with variations of teak, pine and alder. It is hemmed in by many structures and encases a small cobblestone courtyard. On the northeast it is bordered by the tailor's building; on the north is an entrance into a narrow alley; immediately south is the Boarding House; the east side enters the bank; the southwest heads into the Severed Tail tavern. The whole area is open on the west and leads into the rest of the common area. {? | $(this.details:ladder:hidden) || A tall, wooden ladder reaches skyward. } $[$place = ${IronClaw:Rooms:UrOutside};] {? | $(place.details:haybales:hidden) || Several soft, flaxen hay bales are scattered about. }
The east commons. The east commons have been recently repaired with clean, new materials that gives the area a pristine shine.

A large wooden door, leading into the bank. The door itself stands roughly seven foot tall and three foot wide, made out of an indescribable wood, chipped beyond repair. Salt and mould covers the half-rotten planks as a memento of an earlier flood.
